Is it ok to enjoy the material world?

While I get that one should realize that the material world isn't the answer and that we can die at any moment and should therefore put ourselves in the hands of God shouldn't we also be able to go out to dinner with our family and just enjoy the moment? this isn't agnosticism where the material world is evil, right? can't we enjoy the meal and think this is the play of existence? it ain't the end all be all but it can be sweet too, right?
Are there different typs of love? Isn't love just love?

I've been struggling with the idea of love and was hoping to get a perspective on some thoughts. Bhakta means love, but love is always talked about as if there are different forms but I don't see it that way. Love is love to me. Not family love, romantic love, friendship love.. The only difference is, are the relationships that dictate the expression and the strength. But is the love different? Can you love someone or something with no relationship? Can you have a relationship with no love? Everywhere I turn there's this idea of different love but is there different hate? So far I've come to the idea that when you're allowed to be completely your true self with no added conflict, comparison or judgment then it is an environment to allow your love to shine and the ones who allow it are loved ones. Do these teachings have anything to say about these ideas?
Buddhism seems so close to the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita. Do you think Buddha heard the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita before He started preaching?

To what degree should renunciation be part of my practice?

As a householder sometimes there's a need to make purchases. By what criteria should we go about that fact? I know the general suggestion would be to live simple but what exactly does that mean? Does simple have to mean cheap and inexpensive?  That's not always the most practical use for your family. How do you make purchases that are so closely attached to your identity which should be seen as something to renounce, like the car you drive or the watch you wear? They say something about you. Watch is essentially a life partner and the quality of it suggests your status and also makes it perform better as the tool that it is. This thought plagues me
